intro: Lychniothyrsus tetragonus, commonly known as the four-angled nightshade, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features opposite, four-angled leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale purple. Its fruit is a globose capsule that contains several seeds. The plant is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
